name: Pug
description: The Pug is known for its signature traits—loyalty, intelligence, and trainability. Recognized for their confidence and affectionate nature, Pugs excel in family environments, working roles, and active lifestyles.

characteristics.coat: Short, smooth coat with facial folds

adaptability.description: Pugs adapt well to both hot and cold climates, thanks to their coat and overall resilience.

traits.description: These attributes have been rated by dog trainers, expert vets and pet behaviorists. Remember that all dogs are individuals with their own personalities.

diet.title: DIET
diet.subtitle: Consider following tips when choosing food for your Pug.
diet.mainDescription: Pugs thrive on a high-protein, balanced diet rich in animal-based proteins, healthy fats, and essential vitamins to support their active lifestyle and joint health.

tips.title: Choose a protein-rich diet
tips.description: Pugs need controlled calories with easily digestible protein to prevent obesity and support respiratory and joint health.

tips.title: Avoid fillers & additives
tips.description: Pugs should avoid foods with heavy fillers such as wheat and soy that may be difficult to digest or trigger sensitivities.

tips.title: Add Essential Fatty Acids
tips.description: Look for foods containing Omega-3 and Omega-6 fatty acids to support skin, coat, and joint comfort.

tips.title: Consider their age
tips.description: Choose an appropriate diet according to your Pug's age—puppies need more protein and fat for growth, while adult and senior dogs may require lower levels for weight maintenance.

training.title: PUG TRAINING
training.subtitle: Essential training tips to help your Pug thrive.
training.mainDescription: Pugs require regular exercise, proper grooming, socialization, and consistent training to maintain their physical health and mental well-being.

tips.title: Physical training and exercises
tips.description: Include activities such as running, playing fetch, swimming, agility training, or hiking in their routine.

tips.title: Interactive play
tips.description: Use scent-retention games and puzzle toys to provide mental stimulation and keep them engaged.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: Consider following tips when grooming your Pug.
grooming.mainDescription: Pugs have relatively low grooming needs despite their coat type. Here are some essential tips to ensure they shine.

tips.title: Brush and bath
tips.description: Brush regularly to remove loose hair and distribute natural oils. Occasional bathing keeps them clean and fresh.

tips.title: Keep their ears clean
tips.description: Check ears regularly and clean when required with a cotton ball and a mild ear-cleaning solution.

homeCookedFood.title: Home-Cooked Food Must Contain:
homeCookedFood.description: Preparing home-cooked meals may be time consuming and nutritionally incomplete, consider adding food toppers or supplements to make up for the lack of nutrients.
